metadata.title: CVE-2017-6062 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
The "OpenID Connect Relying Party and OAuth 2.0 Resource Server" (akamod_auth_openidc) module before 2.1.5 for the Apache HTTP Server does notskip OIDC_CLAIM_ and OIDCAuthNHeader headers in an "OIDCUnAuthAction pass"configuration, which allows remote attackers to bypass authentication viacrafted HTTP traffic.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-6062` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-auth-openidc - 2.3.3-1build1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libapache2-mod-auth-openidc package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.3.3-1build1').
